textArr:
The Waterfalls of By far the largest state of Malaysia, Sarawak has numerous waterfalls, many of which still have to be explored
   
   


	   Accessability: Easy
	   
	   Picture
	   Name/Location
	   Type
	   Activities
	   Description
	   
	  
	  Bobak FallsWest of Kuching, near Kg Bobak
	  Multiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekking
	  Small romantic waterfalls in an unspoilt region, within easy reach of KuchingLast update March 2007
	 
	  
	  Kubah FallKubah National park, 20 km from Kuching
	  Multiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekking
	  Easily accessible fall in National parkLast update March 2011
	 
	  
	  Latak FallsAlong the Bentulu-Miri road, 30 km from Miri
	  Multiple falls
	  PicnicSwimming
	  Clean and well maintainedLast update November 2007
	 
	  
	  Ranchan FallsNear Serian
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  PicnicSwimming
	  Well maintained Recreational Forest with nice waterfalls.Last update December 2007
	 
	  
	  Santubong fallsSantubong Peninsula, north of Kuching
	  Multiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekking
	  Small attractive waterfalls near KuchingLast update December 2006
	 
	   Accessability: Moderate
	   
	   Picture
	   Name/Location
	   Type
	   Activities
	   Description
	   
	  
	  Giam KlimauSE of Niah National Park
	  Single fall
	  PicnicSwimming
	  A beautiful curtain fall deep inside an oil palm plantationLast update July 2010
	 
	  
	  Gunung Gading FallsNear Lundu
	  Multiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  The Gunung Gading N.P is famous for its Rafflesias, but has also a few nice waterfalls
Last update December 2007
	 
	  
	  Jangkar FallWest of Lundu, near Indonesian border
	  Single fall
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Powerful, remote waterfall near the Inodesian borderLast update June 2009
	 
	  
	  Kg Sadir fallsnear Kg Sadir, 50 km south of Kuching
	  Multiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekking
	  Four waterfalls in the remote Penrissen Range.Two of them have easy access, for the other two trekking is required.Last update November 2011
	 
	  
	  Pantu FallLambir Hills NP, 30 km from Miri
	  Multiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekking
	  There are six waterfalls in the Park, but some of them are temporarily closed to the public.Last update January 2007
	 
	  
	  Sebarau FallNear Kg Bidak south of Kuching
	  Single fall
	  SwimmingTrekking
	  Nice waterfall in unspoiled  rural surroundingsLast update June 2009
	 
	  
	  Tajor Fall 20 km NE of Kuching
	  Single fall
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekking
	  A waterfall in Bako N.P. Beautiful and unspoiled.Last update April 2010
	 
	   Accessability: Difficult
	   
	   Picture
	   Name/Location
	   Type
	   Activities
	   Description
	   
	  
	  Usun Apau falls170 km SSE of  Miri
	  Multiple falls
	  TrekkingCamping
	  Remote waterfalls, difficult access.
The Julan fall is the tallest fall of SarawakLast update April 2010
